comments:
The decorator thread for my workbench died (symptom was that nothing was being 
decorated). The following exception was in the log. I'm not sure what caused it 
but there were a couple of others logs stating "org.eclipse.help f1 does not 
exist" and I did rename the project to something else so it's possible that the 
error was caused by the rename. I have not been able to reprodice it though and 
I'm not sure if the exception caused the decorator thead to die.


org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.CVSException: Could not get "watch/edit" 
property for project 'org.eclipse.help.f1'.
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.CVSTeamProvider.isWatchEditEnabled
(CVSTeamProvider.java(Compiled Code))
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.CVSLightweightDecorator.getOverlay
(CVSLightweightDecorator.java(Compiled Code))
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.CVSLightweightDecorator.decorate
(CVSLightweightDecorator.java(Compiled Code))
at 
org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.LightweightDecoratorManager$LightweightRunnab
le.run(LightweightDecoratorManager.java(Compiled Code))
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.DecorationScheduler$2.run
(DecorationScheduler.java(Compiled Code))
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.DecorationScheduler$2.run
(DecorationScheduler.java(Compiled Code))
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.DecorationScheduler$2.run
(DecorationScheduler.java(Compiled Code))
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.DecorationScheduler$2.run
(DecorationScheduler.java(Compiled Code))
at org.eclipse.ui.internal.decorators.DecorationScheduler$2.run
(DecorationScheduler.java(Compiled Code))
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:512)

Turns out the deorcator thread dies silently. The error was related to other 
strangness in my workspace.

traces.message: Could not get "watch/edit"  property for project 'org.eclipse.help.f1'.
